Comment: Canada and most European countries don’t have compulsory voting and manage to not be as far right and insane as the US. It’s also very hard to rig elections since there are so many precautions and recounts in place and so many local and state governments collect and pour through the data. If there were mass fraud, someone would find it.

Author: pile_of_fish

Comment: Being forced to vote is a contradiction. Voting is inherently an expression of consent, choosing whether, how, or if to participate in the political process. If you are coerced into voting, it’s no longer a voluntary act, which undermines the very principle it’s supposed to uphold: individual choice. Compulsory voting turns a right into an obligation, and a choice into a command, which defeats the moral purpose of the vote itself.

Author: AINonsense

Comment: In Georgia we have electronic voting that prints out a paper ballot you check & then feed into an optical reader that registers your vote. Election workers (at least in my town) are trained to make sure you are satisfied with each step. The optical reader deposits your paper ballot into a lockbox, which is kept to compare to electronic tallies, both in close elections & with random audits by the Secretary of State. (He is a Republican, perfectly at home with voter suppression laws, but balks at actual fraud. You may remember Trump begging him on a phone call in 2021 to "find him some votes" and Lindsey Graham trying to get him to invalidate perfectly legal mail ballots).  Edit: syntax
